availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Richards (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Coats Richards on May 16, 1861 in Bath County, Kentucky. Farmer in Bath County, in 1850. Merchant in Bath County in 1860. Owned one enslaved individual in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 88A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 21.
Find A Grave, "William Richards (Jan. 2, 1812-July 11, 1875)," Memorial #172469728, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/172469728 (accessed March 30, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273007, p. 239.
